comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1) Start the [IBM product based on Eclipse and others -->ask me for details] in a new workspace
2) Click on Samples/Tutorials
3) Find the Hello World 2 sample
4) Click on Import
5) Wait until build finishes.
5a) There is no error on the file:
 /HelloWorldReceiverUIEAR/META-INF/application.xml

The contents of this file are :

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<application xmlns="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" id="Application_ID" version="1.4" xsi:schemaLocation="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee/application_1_4.xsd">
	<display-name>
	HelloWorldReceiverUIEAR</display-name>
	<module id="WebModule_1194364706203">
		<web>
			<web-uri>HelloWorldReceiverUI.war</web-uri>
			<context-root>HelloWorldReceiverUI</context-root>
		</web>
	</module>
<security-role id="SecurityRoleCustomClientUser">
        <description>Custom Client User</description>
        <role-name>CustomClientUser</role-name>
    </security-role>
</application>

6) Select Help>Samples/Tutorials (WebSphere Integration Developer))
7) Find the Hello World 2 sample again.
8) Click Import
9) A "Confirm Overwrite" dialog comes up.
10) Click OK
11) The workspace projects will be deleted
12) The sample contents are imported.
13) When the build completes , there will be
    an error on the file:

   /HelloWorldReceiverUIEAR/META-INF/application.xml

   The error message is:
   A J2EE Enterprise Application must contain one or more modules.


   The contents of this file are now:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<application xmlns="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" id="Application_ID" version="1.4" xsi:schemaLocation="http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee http://java.sun.com/xml/ns/j2ee/application_1_4.xsd">
	<display-name>
	HelloWorldReceiverUIEAR</display-name>
<security-role id="SecurityRoleCustomClientUser">
        <description>Custom Client User</description>
        <role-name>CustomClientUser</role-name>
    </security-role>
</application>

It is missing:

	<module id="WebModule_1194364706203">
		<web>
			<web-uri>HelloWorldReceiverUI.war</web-uri>
			<context-root>HelloWorldReceiverUI</context-root>
		</web>
	</module>




More information:
There  are the following exceptions in the console:
